subject: hypervisor: add support to turn on
commitMessage:
hypervisor: add support to turn on

If the customer has requested the hypervisor stop at its Standby state
vs. booting all the way to Running, then a mechanism is needed to
request the hypervisor boot to Running. A common use case for IBM is
the system user has requested the hypervisor stop at Standby so some
manual debug can be performed and then they want to move the hypervisor
into the Running state so they can boot their operating system.

Asking the hypervisor to stop at Standby is done via the
BootSourceOverrideEnabled and BootSourceOverrideTarget properties under
the redfish/v1/Systems/system.

Utilize the ComputerSystem.Reset action for this. Similar to how
redfish/v1/Systems/system/Actions/ComputerSystem.Reset is utilized for
the overall system, implement a limited subset of it for the hypervisor
object.

Tested:
- Verified when phosphor-hypervisor-state-manager package is not
  installed that Redfish API returns same info it does currently
- Verified when phosphor-hypervisor-state-manager was installed that the
  hypervisor state was returned correctly, the Actions field was filled
  in, and a post to the Action with ResetType set to "On" was correctly
  propagated to RequestedHostTransition
- Verified that an invalid ResetType (i.e. "Off") returned the
  appropriate "invalid parameter" error message to the Redfish API
- Verified no new errors logged by Redfish validator on system with this
  hypervisor package installed

- Verify resource not found when hypervisor not enabled
curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -X POST https://${BMC_IP}/redfish/v1/Systems/hypervisor/Actions/ComputerSystem.Reset -d '{"ResetType": "On"}'
{
  "error": {
    "@Message.ExtendedInfo": [
      {
        "@odata.type": "#Message.v1_1_1.Message",
        "Message": "The requested resource of type Actions named Reset was not found.",
        "MessageArgs": [
          "Actions",
          "Reset"
        ],
        "MessageId": "Base.1.8.1.ResourceNotFound",
        "MessageSeverity": "Critical",
        "Resolution": "Provide a valid resource identifier and resubmit the request."
      }
    ],
    "code": "Base.1.8.1.ResourceNotFound",
    "message": "The requested resource of type Actions named Reset was not found."
  }
}

- Verify ResourceNotFound returned when hypervisor not enabled
curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -X GET https://${BMC_IP}/redfish/v1/Systems/hypervisor/ResetActionInfo
{
  "error": {
    "@Message.ExtendedInfo": [
      {
        "@odata.type": "#Message.v1_1_1.Message",
        "Message": "The requested resource of type hypervisor named ResetActionInfo was not found.",
        "MessageArgs": [
          "hypervisor",
          "ResetActionInfo"
        ],
        "MessageId": "Base.1.8.1.ResourceNotFound",
        "MessageSeverity": "Critical",
        "Resolution": "Provide a valid resource identifier and resubmit the request."
      }
    ],
    "code": "Base.1.8.1.ResourceNotFound",
    "message": "The requested resource of type hypervisor named ResetActionInfo was not found."
  }
}

- Verify input parameters validated
curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -X POST https://${BMC_IP}/redfish/v1/Systems/hypervisor/Actions/ComputerSystem.Reset -d '{"ResetTypeInvalid": "On"}'
{
  "ResetTypeInvalid@Message.ExtendedInfo": [
    {
      "@odata.type": "#Message.v1_1_1.Message",
      "Message": "The property ResetTypeInvalid is not in the list of valid properties for the resource.",
      "MessageArgs": [
        "ResetTypeInvalid"
      ],
      "MessageId": "Base.1.8.1.PropertyUnknown",
      "MessageSeverity": "Warning",
      "Resolution": "Remove the unknown property from the request body and resubmit the request if the operation failed."
    }
  ]
}

curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -X POST https://${BMC_IP}/redfish/v1/Systems/hypervisor/Actions/ComputerSystem.Reset -d '{"ResetType": "OnInvalid"}'
{
  "ResetType@Message.ExtendedInfo": [
    {
      "@odata.type": "#Message.v1_1_1.Message",
      "Message": "The value OnInvalid for the property ResetType is not in the list of acceptable values.",
      "MessageArgs": [
        "OnInvalid",
        "ResetType"
      ],
      "MessageId": "Base.1.8.1.PropertyValueNotInList",
      "MessageSeverity": "Warning",
      "Resolution": "Choose a value from the enumeration list that the implementation can support and resubmit the request if the operation failed."
    }
  ]
}

Change has been successfully merged by Andrew Geissler
s needs checked against nullptr before dereferencing.
Done, removed with move to mapper call
This seems a little odd that you're using a Get to determine if the property/interface exists?  wouldn't you just call the mapper?
Done
You can only turn it on, not off?  Should we be getting this list of allowable values from dbus somehow?

Yeah, we had some debates back and forth in the PDI review on whether to create a new interface for the Hypervisor or to just utilize the existing Host interface. The decision there was to utilize the Host one instead of creating something new. That means we only support a subset of it though. I'm not sure of anyway to make that clear on D-Bus. We could allow them all in bmcweb and get the "Unsupported" error back from the D-Bus object? I'd prefer what we have here but let me know.
Don't use res.end() in new code (even in simple cases like this, where it's obviously correct).
Done

but the client posted this action.
I think we need to fail, otherwise the client is going to get a 200/204 back and think it worked.

message::ActionNotSupported ?
Ed thoughts?

This isn't part of an action, this is part of a GET request, so it not existing isn't an issue.

I suspect this needs to be called "getHypervisorActions" or something similar to avoid the naming issue.
Done. Yeah, was thinking we're "setting" the response but get makes more sense.
message::ActionNotSupported ?
if objInfo.size() > 1 it should be internal error.
Done

I should have paid more attention but this confused me.. Can this be getHypervisorActions ?
specially since the one above is getHypervisorState?
not all systems support hypervisors.  This info can't be populated if we're on a system that doesn't.

I was thinking since we only put ResetActionInfo in the response to a GET on /redfish/v1/Systems/hypervisor that we'd be ok. But yeah, if someone doesn't utilize the dynamic discovery of Redfish and hard codes (i.e. REDFISH.md) a GET on ResetActionInfo, this would pop up on unsupported systems. I'll add a check to make sure it's available.

shouldn't we check first if we have ResetType ?
If not return ActionParameterMissing ?

> shouldn't we check first if we have ResetType ?
hmm, something more then the above code?

> If not return ActionParameterMissing ?
Yep, let me add this to the return

I know you got this from https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/1a2a14379d515c393cc134ea719d56efbae2116e/redfish-core/lib/systems.hpp#L1976
but I feel 

PropertyValueNotInList (probably my pick)
ActionParameterValueFormatError
https://redfish.dmtf.org/registries/Base.1.9.0.json
are better.

Really Redfish needs another message here for ActionParameterValueNotInList

I opened https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish/issues/4437 

Because this is really talking about if a client were to pass "Resett" with the action (note the extra t)

        "ActionParameterUnknown": {
            "Description": "Indicates that an action was submitted but a parameter supplied did not match any of the known parameters.",
            "LongDescription": "This message shall be used to indicate that an action was submitted but a parameter supplied did not match any of the known parameters.",
            "Message": "The action %1 was submitted with the invalid parameter %2.",

Done. Thanks for opening the issue!
I think the PropertyValueNotInList error reads the most clean here. ""The value " + arg1 + " for the property " + arg2 + "is not in the list of acceptable values."
Also needs to handle 404 if the hypervisor object doesn't exist at all.
ok, I'm not super familiar with this. Should I just utilize the resourceNotFound error or do I need something more specific for an action not being found? I'll put some code up for input.
remove.
I guess you want the "return" statement in both the if/else clauses vs. just one like this to hit the whole if(ec) code?
error: do not use 'else' after 'return' [readability-else-after-return,-warnings-as-errors]

Typically it is 
std::shared_ptr<AsyncResp> asyncResp
Done

Done
Have you checked this against the privilege registry?
Thanks Gunnar

as a side note, this is the right way to detect the presence of the hypervisor.  All the other code that looks for the hostname param is wrong and should be fixed.

With that said, not a problem in your commit:  Good work.
I'll add it onto my TODO cleanup list

as written, this will post 2 error codes to the message.  What you want is to declare resetType as a std::optional<std::string>, then have a presence check below to check for existence and return this error code.
Done
Done
I would've expected this to have a specific error code value it checked before declaring 404.  For example, if the dbus connection failed, this should return internal error, not resource not found.
ok, I did a bit of testing and found when the object is not there we get a EHOSTUNREACH(host_unreachable) error back so I'll specifically look for that.
I saw your comment but always best to put the validator in the commit msg. (I could have missed it)
Yeah, a bit confusing. I have it below in bullet 4. I just was unable to re-run after addressing my code review comments until yesterday.
Not sure this one makes sense, would think 404 here, I'll let Ed weigh in.

I wanted to retest this but when I rebuild my code based off of latest bmcweb master the hypervisor object is gone all together. I'm not sure what's going on so back to a -1 until I can get to the bottom of it.

ok, I had just lost my patch that adds the hypervisor settings object which is needed to have this object show up. Ed, let me know if you'd prefer a 404 here. The thinking was that it's an optional object based on whether the hypervisor state package is installed so I just returned nothing.
Yep.  I'd expect 404 here if the hypervisor isn't present.  A 200 error code when the operation failed doesn't really seem valid.
Done
you can't just return an empty object if the route isn't supported.  We need to return 404 and 500 here in the two cases.
Done
nit: technically could be std::move(command).
Done
